Food science is the multidisciplinary study of food, incorporating various fields such as biology, chemistry, physics, engineering and nutrition. It focuses on the foundations of food production, safety, nutrition and sustainability. The main objective of food scientists is to research new methods and technologies for improving existing foods and creating innovative products.

Some major applications of food science include:

1. Ensuring Food Safety: Food scientists investigate ways to prevent contamination by harmful microorganisms or hazardous substances in our food supply chain systems by developing safe processing techniques and formulations.

2. Enhancing Nutrition: As modern lifestyles change people's diets resulting in nutritional deficiencies, it becomes crucial for researchers to develop foods that have higher levels of essential nutrients such as vitamins and minerals.

3. Improving Food Quality: Texture, flavor and appearance are important aspects when it comes down to consumers enjoying their meals; thus chefs & manufacturers rely on scientific knowledge regarding ingredients properties like stabilizing agents etcetera that may help them achieve desirable outcomes at a lower cost but still maintaining high standards overall within an industry context where competition can be fierce among rival brands vying market-share etcetera
